Title: Real Estate Operations Summer Intern
Required Qualifications:
Job Information

Citizens Bank Real Estate Operations Summer Internship in Johnston, Rhode Island

Description

Real Estate Operations provides facility related services and amenities to all our buildings and branches. These include:
• Repairs & Maintenance
• Energy Services
• Fire, Life and Safety
• Cafeteria Services
• Building Improvements
• Janitorial Services
• Snow Removal

In this internship you will assist the Property, Real Estate Operations team as needed. The intern role will work closely with the Facility Management team; work responsibilities include supporting the creation of the Back Office Etiquette Program Playbook, updating the existing FM Playbook, supporting our new Capital Planning software, creating a reporting dashboard of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for the Real Estate Operations team, and other tasks as assigned.

Other responsibilities will include:
• Fulfilling project administrative reporting requirements
• Providing assistance to department as needed
• Preparing status reports and documenting through the use of computerized systems and project management software applications

• The position is a technical and analytical position which will support strategic responsibility that will be part of the Real Estate Operations team
• The position will support creating and analyzing various technical, engineering service reports to support initiatives and projects that are part of the 2021 Business Plan

Qualifications
• Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Business related area
• Expected graduation date of May 2022
• Microsoft Office Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook (Beginner to Advanced)
• Communication strong written and verbal
• Excellent attention to detail
• Ability to operate independently

Hours per Week: 40

Work Schedule: M - Th

Why Work for Us

At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth.

The intern will be splitting time between Research and Eric Wojak, SR. Development Director -Mixed Use, in the Luxury Leased Homes division. Title: Credit Operations Intern
Required Qualifications:
Berkadia, a joint venture of Berkshire Hathaway and Jefferies Financial Group, is a leader in the commercial real estate industry, offering a robust suite of services to our multifamily and commercial property clients. Powered by deep relationships and industry-changing technology, our people sell, finance, and service commercial real estate, providing support for the entire life cycle of our clients' assets. Our unique ownership structure allows us to put the client's interests first and creates a marketplace that delivers a superior experience.

Overall, Berkadia's Credit Group Has Wide Ranging Responsibility Including
• Credit Policy and Decision-making with respect to FNMA and PLG, SBL, and w/r/t HUD, credit recommendations
• Credit Underwriting and compliance with applicable guidelines for FMNA, PLG, SBL, HUD, Targeted Affordable and to the extent requested, FMLC loans through the CPO group
• Monitoring and Reporting to the shareholders on Berkadia's risk, particularly with respect to FNMA and PLG
• Surveillance and Decision-Making on all PLG loans post-closing
• Collaboration with Servicing on all material issues regarding FNMA loans post-closing
• Management / oversight of Berkadia Credit's India Operations
• Dotted Line responsibility for the Small Balance Loan Product
• Collaboration with Innovative Technology Products related to data and underwriting

The Opportunity

The Credit Operations Intern will work with senior underwriting leadership to shape Underwriting strategy, provide ad-hoc strategic decision support, and deliver process / technology improvements. This role reports directly to the VP, Credit Operations but will be responsible for stakeholder relationships across the firm.
• Credit Policy and Decision-making with respect to FNMA and PLG, SBL, and w/r/t HUD, credit recommendations
• Credit Underwriting and compliance with applicable guidelines for FMNA, PLG, SBL, HUD, Targeted Affordable and to the extent requested, FMLC loans through the CPO group
• Monitoring and Reporting to the shareholders on Berkadia's risk, particularly with respect to FNMA and PLG
• Surveillance and Decision-Making on all PLG loans post-closing
• Collaboration with Servicing on all material issues regarding FNMA loans post-closing
• Management / oversight of Berkadia Credit's India Operations
• Dotted Line responsibility for the Small Balance Loan Product
• Collaboration with Innovative Technology Products related to data and underwriting

What someone will need to be successful in this role
• Currently enrolled in a bachelor's or master's degree program. A real estate, finance. or business data analytics related major is helpful.
• Someone who is ready to be an owner – can take ambiguous problems, structure them, and determine a path forward, including requesting the resources necessary to accomplish the task
• Ability to work successfully with minimum oversight under a matrix management structure
• Experience in Microsoft Office including Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel
• Power BI skills strongly preferred, but not required
• Strong organizational skills and ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities
• Outstanding attention to detail
• Ability to manage expectations, informing stakeholders of potential delays due to conflicting priorities
• Can-do, proactive attitude that can mean making suggestions and giving options rather than waiting for answers
• Able to communicate clearly both verbally and in writing with all levels of an organization
• Desire to learn about careers in the Commercial Real Estate industry

Title: 2021 Summer Analyst, Real Estate Management and Operations
Intern, Real Estate Development
Required Qualifications:
Enterprise is a national nonprofit on a mission to make home and community places of pride, power and belonging for all. To make that possible, we operate the only organization designed to address America’s affordable housing crisis from every angle: we develop and deploy programs and support community organizations on the ground; we advocate for policy on a nonpartisan basis at every level of government; we invest capital to build and preserve rental homes people can afford; and we own, operate and provide resident services for affordable communities. All so that people not only make rent, they build futures. With this end-to-end approach, 40 years of experience and thousands of local partners, Enterprise has built and preserved 793,000 affordable homes, invested $61 billion in communities and changed millions of lives.

Enterprise offers career opportunities in our offices across the country with an exceptional benefits package .

Job Description Summary

Enterprise Community Development, Inc. (“ECD”) is the leading Mid-Atlantic nonprofit developer, owner, and operator of a $1 billion portfolio of 110+ apartment communities and 16,000+ homes. As part of the Enterprise family, ECD has access to a full suite of capital resources, housing solutions, and public policy support. Formed from two legacy organizations, Enterprise Homes, Inc., and Community Preservation and Development Corporation (CPDC), ECD has a combined 60 years of experience building and preserving affordable housing to uplift communities for economic stability and mobility.

The Intern will work with the Real Estate Development team to build and refine complicated Microsoft Excel models regarding the financing of affordable and mixed income housing projects, while providing support for project specific tasks that may include non-financial areas of the development process

Responsibilities

Job Description
Collect existing financial proformas from real estate development staff and create a consolidated Excel spreadsheet that integrates the presentation and functionality of existing models while making enhancement under direction of supervisor.
Develop a “feasibility” model in Microsoft Excel that builds off existing examples within ECD but integrates financial feasibility with zoning and construction inputs.
Work closely with one ongoing project in one of these key areas; prospective project, predevelopment project, or construction. Assist and shadow the development associate or officer on the project to help with daily needs and learn about this stage of the development process. Examples of tasks will be creating spreadsheets, looking at market research, mapping, creating presentations, and attending onsite meetings.

Qualifications
College graduate student with coursework and/or experience in real estate development, finance or urban planning is required.
Awareness of underlying formulas of real estate finance is essential.
Basic and advanced Excel modeling skills are a requirement including the ability to program Look Up and If Than functions.
Knowledge of land use and neighborhood planning and real estate development concepts are a plus
Training and Support
Orientation to ECD and its communities. Development of initial work plan and timeline with supervisor related to above tasks. Weekly meetings to review, plan, and provide coaching around various aspects of the internship experience. Participate in staff meetings, external meetings, and trainings as available and relevant to the scope of the position. Participate in an intern program feedback process.
Learning Opportunities
Witness the affordable housing development process from project selection to construction to asset management and resident engagement.
Experience the day to day operations of a real estate development in an affordable housing corporation and understand the federal, state, and local policies and programs used in this industry and how they influence operations of a nonprofit developer.
Gain exposure to the financing tools used in the industry, including Low-Income Housing Tax Credits (LIHTC), HUD financing products, and programs (e.g. Section 8), GSE products (e.g.’ Fannie Mae) and typical local government programs.
Develop a working knowledge of the policies and tools that local governments use in urban planning, land use, and real property development (e.g. comprehensive plans, small area plans and affordable housing policies.
Learn to function in a team environment and experience how the work develops through team meetings on a project, with staff, lenders, government stakeholders, and development consultants (e.g. architects and civil engineers).
Remote and virtual work available.

Required Qualifications:
Best people + right culture. These are the driving forces behind JE Dunn’s strategy for success. By hiring the best people we can find, giving them interesting and challenging work, and letting them share in the company’s rewards, we’ve found a sustainable way to grow in our industry for the last 90+ years.

JE Dunn believes in providing the best tools for employees to get the job done right. Lean operation processes. Digital document collaboration. LEED-certified, occupant-focused environments. We make sure our workforce is prepared for the job, and we expect the best. Our diverse teams around the country strive to enrich lives through inspired people and places every day, and we need inspired people like you to join us in our pursuit of building perfection.

Role Summary

Key Role Responsibilities - Core

Internship Overview – Projects And Responsibilities
Assist in screening of new investment opportunities, financial modeling, due diligence, and SREO updates as needed.

Assist in identifying and researching industry trends, and the competitive landscape of the markets across the country.
Entails reviewing third party research reports and preparing summarized reports for team members to review.
Collaborate with company employees in Pre-construction Services for new development opportunities.

Work with project leads to obtain project related bids for certain properties.

Assist in consolidating relevant information/questions in the focus areas where the team needs coordination help. This could be lead generation, and/or partnership opportunities.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Able to be flexible
High energy
Leadership potential
Strong work ethic
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Works well under pressure and in deadline situations


Education
Enrollment in accredited Bachelors Degree program or higher, and coursework in the area(s) related to the internship opportunity


Experience

N/A

Employee-focused culture
Whether it’s our Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), company wellness program, or modern workspaces, we put the satisfaction of our employees at the forefront of everything we do.

Award-winning Benefits Package

Named one of Plan Sponsor Magazine’s 2015 Plan Sponsors of the Year, JE Dunn’s employee benefits package ranks among the top of our peer group, meeting and exceeding standard expectations.

Professional training opportunities
Our employee development team works full-time to create growth opportunities across the company. We encourage employees to take command of their own development, and we make sure they have what they need to take that next step.

Community-driven workforce
Corporate and personal involvement in the communities in which we work is simply part of the job--JE Dunn as an organization is proud to donate over 10 percent of our pre-tax earnings to charities around the country each year.

JE Dunn Construction is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. Title: Real Estate Development Intern
Required Qualifications:
We know that BUILDING HOMES & COMMUNITIES BEGINS WITH BUILDING THE BEST TEAM!

How would you like to be a part of team that has been providing the American Dream of homeownership to families for more than 60 years? PulteGroup is a FORTUNE 500 company and one of America’s top residential builders. We put the consumer at the center of everything we do and we stand above the competition in our commitment to quality.

Our Vision is to Build Consumer Inspired Homes & Communities to Make Lives Better and we believe that success starts with having the right people.

At PulteGroup, we are committed to diversity and inclusion. We value the differences of each employee and understand that being consumer inspired means that we reflect the diversity of the consumers we serve.

The Tucson team is constantly evaluating sites for development, project managing new developments, and overseeing construction of new neighborhoods. PulteGroup in Tucson offers three distinct brands to consumers- Pulte Homes, Del Webb, and Centex. We are growing our pipeline of projects and have opened an opportunity for an internship in our Tucson office. Assist in the evaluation and underwriting process for potential residential real estate developments

Title: Real Estate Marketing Internship (Paid)
Required Qualifications:
Our successful, high energy, and fast growing real estate team is seeking a talented, results-driven and enthusiastic individual to be our Marketing Intern. We are an upbeat and proactive group who work hard, have a passion for real estate, and support one another in a great working environment.
The intern will be provided with learning opportunities throughout the organization so they understand the fundamentals of marketing and transactional work in the residential real estate industry following their experience.
From an everyday perspective, the intern will assist with day-to-day responsibilities, contribute to business development initiatives, and carry out tasks for the team leader, marketing director, and operations manager. Ultimately, ensuring the team maintains optimal performance. The position of intern is responsible for supporting team members in extensive marketing projects, transactional assistance, business matters, client relations, and retention.
The ideal candidate will be a detail-oriented, self-motivator, self-starter, able to work well in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines, demonstrate clear communication skills, be motivated to learn, and exhibit a strong work ethic – with a passion and interest for a career in marketing and transactional work within Residential Real Estate.
This full time opportunity offers hourly compensation with a flexible schedule. If you are ready to add an invaluable opportunity to your resume, gain more industry experience, and have fun while you do it, we want to hear from you.

An opportunity for long term employment is available, dependent on performance.

Title: Real Estate Intern
Company: First Community Credit Union - Houston, TX
Required Qualifications:
As a member of the Real Estate team, you will have the opportunity to gain valuable experience in a wide range of mortgage lending duties and functions while working to advance our organization’s practices. This will be done through knowledge and understanding gained on all services and products within the real estate department encompassing all matters of mortgage, home equity, and home improvement loan requirements, guidelines, and policies. As your knowledge and experience expand, the real estate intern will learn to process mortgage and construction loans, including those for investors and in-house loans, as well as, the ability to process home improvement and home equity loans.

Our Real Estate Intern will have the opportunity to work through our loan origination system with knowledge gained for proper input of loan applications, ordering of credit reports, as well as which applications to run through the underwriting platform for conventional loans. They will gain knowledge and understanding of the necessary documentation needed to present loan applications to underwriting, and additionally, gain an understanding of the clearing conditions from the underwriters.

This individual will assist the Real Estate department with member communication via inbound/outbound calls, emails, and other methods of communication as necessary. They will understand the loan closing process and be able to coordinate closings with borrowers and title companies. They will also become knowledgeable of the denial process and will assist in sending our denial letters for real estate loans as directed.

Requirements: Must be pursuing a Bachelor’s or graduate-level degree with a business designation.

Desirable Traits
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Self-motivated to achieve goals
Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Proficient computer skills with the ability to learn mortgage software platforms, spreadsheets, and word processing


About Us

First Community Credit Union (FCCU) was chartered in southeast Texas in 1954 to serve the employees of the Spring Branch Independent School District. In 1988, FCCU expanded membership to include the Greater Houston Area, thereafter adding Fort Bend and Montgomery Counties in the 2000s. Over the years, First Community Credit Union has grown to become one of the largest credit unions in Houston with over $1B+ in assets. We have always operated under the philosophy of people-helping-people. First Community Credit Union continues to lead the way as a high-tech, high-touch credit union with leading digital services including Online Banking, Mobile Banking, iPhone/Android Apps, and more. FCCU also works to ensure our members are backed by the latest in security, launching products including EMV chip cards and My Money Maps. As a full-service financial institution, First Community Credit Union proudly serves the daily financial needs of over 130,000 members at our 17 locations.

Job Title

Corporate Real Estate Intern

When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work. You’ll have the opportunity to grow and learn in a culture that empowers your development. We have created an inclusive, global environment that values the power of diverse talent, backgrounds, and experiences to drive speed, productivity, innovation, and growth.

Our internship program will give you a chance to get real world business experience and build your network before graduation. We are seeking an energetic, responsible intern to join our growing organization. In this position, you will be expected to learn the ins-and-outs of our daily routines and procedures. You will focus on learning how our organization runs, and can be expected to gain valuable insight that can further your interest in your chosen career field.

Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science. With revenues of $25 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our 80,000 employees the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world. The customers we serve fall within pharmaceutical and biotech companies, hospitals and clinical diagnostic labs, universities, research institutions and government agencies. Our products and services help accelerate the pace of scientific discovery, and solve challenges ranging from complex research to routine testing to field applications.

Summary Of Internship

The Corporate Real Estate Internship position provides an opportunity for students who are currently pursuing a management, real estate, facilities, construction, or architectural related degree to get hands on experience working with professionals in a fast-paced environment. They will be a part of the global corporate real estate team that supports over 31 million square feet of space in over 50 countries. They should have an analytical background with some experience in real estate and a passion for continuous improvement and excellence. The intern should be creative with an attention to detail and the desire to manage and design space delivering the best employee and visitor experience, while supporting the company’s businesses in a fiscally responsible manner to ensure we’re maximizing shareholder value. The position starts in June, paid working 40 hours per week through August.

Essential Functions
Will work closely with the Director of Global Real Estate and the team on projects involving Thermo Fisher properties
Will be mentored by Real Estate Manager, Director of PMO (Project Management Office), Senior Office Services and other functional personnel to help develop the intern's skill set
Will have exposure to project management process for real estate including becoming familiar with the various technology platforms the group currently uses to support the portfolio and their facilities
Will participate in various quarterly reviews with the company’s divisional leadership teams and corporate functions such as IT, Security, Risk Management and other adjacent groups
Will help to review department’s reporting tools including the quarterly real estate report; the intern will be expected to evaluate and recommend ways to enhance these reports to provide better data analytics to the company
Will participate in developing KPIs and other ways to manage, evaluate and improve third party vendors such as facilities service providers, and CRE partners such as brokerage and project managers
Support an ongoing initiative to publish an updated corporate real estate playbook to document standards and processes as well as reviewing the company’s new Global Flexible Workplace Strategy and other ways to help drive improved productivity and space optimization
Participate in the team’s annual real estate meeting with exposure to the global team in Mid-June
Assist the facilities team with the day to day operation of the company’s global headquarters and become familiar with daily tasks to help review and make recommendations on ways we can improve the service delivery and overall efficiency of the team
Specific tasks will be tailored to the intern’s experience level and abilities
Accept candid feedback and look for areas of opportunity for continuous improvement and improved productivity

Skills And Abilities
Ability to work independently and as a member of a cross-functional team
Willingness to learn, be mentored, and improve their aptitude in global real estate
Desire to contribute and improve new and existing real estate processes
Exceptional customer focus – we strive to exceed expectations
Desire to teach members of the team about technology, trends and in other areas of expertise that can help improve the team’s ability to deliver best in class real estate solutions
Desire to contribute and improve new and existing real estate processes

Qualifications
Student currently enrolled in classes leading to a degree in a related field
Familiar with real estate, preferably commercial properties, construction or design

At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 80,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Apply today!

Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

Our mission is to build and enhance high quality communities using innovative ideas and solutions that create value for our investors, residents and associates. 

The Development Intern will be responsible for supporting the Development and structured finance teams in providing financial modeling, deal underwriting and analysis, market research, transaction due diligence, and approval memoranda for development and acquisitions. This position offers an excellent opportunity to learn and experience the real estate development business. 

Who you are

You’re productive in collaborative team settings as well as on your own, and either way you deliver quality work. You’re a pro at communicating on and off the page, and understand the importance of building great relationships. You keep a cool head while managing multiple projects in a fast-paced environment. Above all, you always demonstrate impeccable judgement and integrity.

What you’ll do:

Conducts long term market research, and rent studies
Performs financial analysis
Assists with due diligence
Writes memoranda
Produces reports, including cash flow projections, excel modeling, and associated sensitivity analyses
Prepare development pro forma and perform financial feasibility and sensitivity analysis
Works closely with NY Development team members
Attend meetings with architects, sellers, brokers, site visits, etc.
Create and maintain routine and ad hoc reporting
Assist with closings
What you’ll bring

Currently pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree in Architecture, Real Estate, Finance, Computer Science, or Business with a strong record of academic achievement
Familiarity with ESRI
General understanding of real estate and development industry
Strong Excel skills and financial modeling experience
General understanding of financial statement.
Excellent written communication skills
Key Program Components:

Internships last 8 - 12 weeks
Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States
Carmel Partners will not sponsor visas for this position
This is a paid internship program. Compensation is based on company guidelines. No additional benefits are offered with this position

Title: University Intern, Ankura Real Estate Advisory Services
Required Qualifications:
Ankura is a team of excellence founded on innovation and growth.

This position supports the Ankura Turnaround & Restructuring Business Group - one of seven practices focused on client delivery services across the Firm.

Position Summary: Ankura has an immediate opening for an Intern within our Ankura Real Estate Advisory Services (AREA) team. The Intern will provide support for AREA projects and professionals located across the United States. The intern will assist in each of AREA’s four key disciplines – Turnaround and Restructuring; Advisory; Valuation and Litigation Support and Expert Witness Testimony; along with working with our industry leading Hospitality and Leisure Group.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Working on active engagements including Creditor Restructuring, Asset Management, Company Restructuring Advisory and Interim Management

Assisting clients in real estate portfolios and business enterprises to achieve their short, medium, and long term goals, and generate sustainable bottom line results
Assisting in providing customized solutions with the optimal combination of debt and equity, private placements, strategic partnerships, privatization, public private partnership financing, securitizations, incentives, and structured finance to our clients;
Actively working with our Hospitality and Leisure Group

Basic Qualifications, Skills, And Characteristics
Ability to work in a team environment as well as work autonomously to accomplish complicated tasks with limited supervision
Resourcefulness and ability to take initiative, including self-motivation
Willingness to support teammates in tackling the group’s workload
High attention to detail
Strong written and oral communication skills
Ability to multi-task and prioritize projects and portfolios; strong time-management skills
Ability to represent the organization and team by projecting a positive and professional image at all times
High level of intellectual curiosity
Ability to work effectively and efficiently
Dedication to the growth of the company and the desire to provide credible, reliable data to our clients on a consistent and timely basis

Title: Summer Real Estate Intern
Required Qualifications:
What began as a very small team more than three decades ago has grown into a nationally recognized leader in the real estate investment industry, and Wedgewood is ready for our next class of interns who share our drive to innovate, take risks, and grow. If you’re looking for a company that empowers their team and a chance to learn more than just data entry, you’ve found it. Our summer interns will specialize in their preferred fields, gaining hands-on real-world experience. You won’t just learn about Real Estate - you’ll learn about investment strategy, acquisitions, real estate brokerage, design and flips, asset management, and more, all in a competitive and fun environment.

Up for the challenge? We are looking for well-rounded, hardworking students who are eager to learn alongside successful professionals in a fast-paced team setting. Our program is designed so that you can gain a meaningful, consolidated and in-depth view of our business, giving you the tools you need to succeed long-term. 40% of our interns in the past received full-time offers - will you be next?

What You’ll Do
Assist our real estate brokerage team- Maxim Properties on regular projects
Work collaboratively with other departments on special intern projects
Perform additional duties as needed, including data entry, filing, and maintaining organizational systems

What You’ll Need
Junior or Senior class standing at your University or College
Coursework experience in Real Estate
Strong communication, organization, and time management skills
The ability to work collaboratively
Drive to learn, and willingness to take on challenges

What's In It For You
Direct exposure to high profile, successful entrepreneurs
Insight into the real estate industry and Wedgewood’s multiple lines of business including:
Acquisition & Rehab
Real Estate Brokerage: Asset Sales
Asset Management
Accounting & Finance
Private Money Lending
Legal
IT
The potential for full-time employment after graduation
If you are hired as a full-time employee after your internship, you will enjoy the subsequent benefits and perks.

Title: Summer Intern, Property Operations - Asset Management
Company: New York City Economic Development Corporation
Required Qualifications: Our Vision : To make New York City the global model for inclusive innovation and economic growth, fueled by the City’s diverse people and businesses. Our Mission : To create shared prosperity across New York City’s five boroughs by strengthening neighborhoods and growing good jobs. Want to be part of an organization changing NYC? Do you see yourself giving back to a community? Want to help change the NYC skyline? Want to create jobs and strengthen neighborhoods? Asset Management makes it happen. NYCEDC’s Asset Management (AM) Division manages the overall strategy for conventional and non-traditional assets across all five boroughs of New York City including commercial real estate properties as well as transportation, critical infrastructure, and energy assets. The Asset Management division pursues a double-bottom line strategy, targeting not just economic returns but also multiple social metrics including but not limited to job creation and growing equitable neighborhoods. The overall assets are divided into multiple portfolios, each managed by a Portfolio Manager/SVP, with a Portfolio Surveillance group that monitors and enforces standards and practices across the portfolio. The division-wide portfolio encompasses all property types including those that are standard in the real estate industry (Retail, Mixed-Use/Commercial, Industrial, etc.) with individual Portfolio Managers also managing assets particular to public sector and public/private partnerships (Transportation assets including Ferry, Cruise, Freight/Rail, and Aviation, Retail and Market assets, Cultural, Industrial and Commercial assets). In fiscal year 2018, the department actively managed over 220 properties and over 64 million square feet at a 94% occupancy rate, generating more than $240 million in revenue. Your Internship: Spend 12 weeks interning with NYCEDC and learn about asset management, double-bottom line financing, and value capture. You’ll have leadership engagements, tour EDC assets, attend company events and more. Asset Management interns are integrated into teams and will do real, hands-on work. At NYCEDC, you will help with advancing large scale catalytic developments, drive comprehensive neighborhood planning, maintain quality jobs today and grow innovative jobs for tomorrow. Summer internships are typically full-time (Mon-Fri, 9am-5pm). All internships are paid. Responsibilities may include: Work on active development projects in the industrial sector Oversee tenant communications and respond to tenant requests Assist project managers in overseeing property requests and working with field team to respond accordingly. Oversee and build a robust inspection tracking sheet for all of our 65+ properties Oversee and maintain our tracking sheet to highlight in office cost savings at our properties Prepare proposal packages and oversee invoices to ensure billing is correct Attend and assist at property events, oversee set up for internal departments and act as the point of contact on site. Respond to requests for site access, walkthroughs and informational sessions. Work with building managers on overseeing building systems, creating tracking systems to monitor state of good repair Track requests for the NYC Ferry system and assist the Project Manager in responding to requests from internal and external stakeholders. Assist in preparing the annual property budget and long-term capital investment plans. Conduct random visits to tenants in order to maintain customer satisfaction. Monitor all tenant improvements ensuring compliance with building codes and insurance regulations. Respond to all tenant emergencies. Provide immediate action to alleviate problems. Interact with all tenants at various levels. Qualifications: Eligible applicants include any graduate student currently enrolled in an urban planning, city planning, economic development, urban studies, real estate development, business, transportation, logistics, or related program A GPA of 3.0 or higher Impressive academic and extracurricular qualifications, consistently strong performance, and a passion for innovation and success An ability to work and communicate well in a fast paced environment while interacting with a wide variety of people Teamwork and problem-solving skills A willingness to accept responsibility, ask tough questions, and solve problems Passion for public service and New York City Bachelor’s Degree in Facilities Management, Architecture, Engineering, Business or equivalent 1-3 years' experience in building, and/or maintenance management Experience overseeing multiple properties and projects with competing priorities Strong interpersonal skills Ability to work with maintenance and janitorial staff Experience in project management and easily able to communicate with contractors for project updates Capable user of computers and such programs as Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, Access, and PowerPoint Strong written and oral communication skills Ability to work with diverse staff, while providing solutions to team members, tenants and self Ability to work in a team environment and to work on individual projects with minimal oversight

Title: Summer Internship
Required Qualifications:
Summary

Rialto Capital Advisors:

Rialto Capital is a leading commercial real estate investment and asset management company. Since 2009, Rialto has raised over $9 billion with its global partners. Rialto’s Investment Management group invests this capital into both debt and equity holdings while the Asset Management group works to ensure profitable return.

Summer Internship Program

Rialto Capital offers a 10 week Summer Internship Program designed to immerse our Summer Interns in the daily activities of 1 of our real estate asset management or operations divisions. Summer Interns will be assigned to a specific departments based on the Summer Intern’s interests and skill set.

The program starts with a formal orientation and in-depth asset management training. Responsibilities will vary by department, but will mirror the responsibilities of a fulltime analyst with the company. Summer Interns will also have the opportunity to participate in educational workshops, speaker events, and networking opportunities. Each Summer Intern will be paired with a current Rialto Analyst or Associate mentor.

As the summer concludes, successful Summer Interns may be invited to join the Rialto team in the fall as an Analyst within a specific department or in our Rotational Analyst program for the upcoming year.

Basic Qualifications
Current undergraduate Junior, first year MBA student, or 1L/2L in law school
Passion for real estate
Highly analytical and collaborative
Strong work ethic and organizational abilities
Proficiency in Excel
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to relocate to Miami, FL for the summer

Program Features
10 week program commencing June 2021
Located in Miami, FL
Real estate industry experience Career mentors & educational programing

Asset Management Departments

CMBS Performing Loans : Evaluates various real estate transactions including leasing matters, property sales, property management changes, hotel franchise agreements, etc. An intern in this group will be responsible for performing qualitative and quantitative analysis and subsequently presenting conclusions to the team’s approval committee.

CMBS Loan Workout : Recommends resolution strategies for non-performing loans such as: loan modification, foreclosure, forbearance, discounted payoff, etc. An intern in this group will perform qualitative and quantitative analysis to recommend the most appropriate resolution for a respective loan.

Real Estate Asset Management : Assesses, manages and liquidates real estate owned by Rialto or its subsidiaries. An intern in this group will analyze each owned property to determine its optimal holding period and market value.

Collateral Surveillance : Monitors risk factors associated with the properties underlying Rialto’s CMBS bond investments. Leads annual RE-Underwriting initiative of CMBS loans. An intern in this group will conduct market research and evaluate cash flow projections of CMBS loans.

Operations Departments

CMBS Compliance : Promotes and ensures compliance with transaction documentation and regulatory requirements. The Compliance Team also monitors and evaluates industry and market developments and promote the adherence to best practices across Asset Management departments.

CMBS Investor Reporting : Prepares various CREFC investor reporting, including the Special Servicing Report, fee invoices, liquidations, and ARA calculations. An intern in this group will work with asset managers to board modifications, forbearance agreements, and other workout scenarios.

Working Conditions

While performing the duties of this job, the Associate is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; balance; stoop. The Associate must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Evening and/or weekend work may be necessary to meet deadlines. This description outlines the basic tasks and requirements for the position noted. It is not a comprehensive listing of all job duties.

Rialto Capital is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity. Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunity to all applicants and Associates without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age (40+), disability, veteran status, genetic information (including family medical history), or any other legally protected status.

Title: Real Estate Intern (Summer 2021)
Required Qualifications:
Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.

We operate development centers in Plymouth, Michigan; Southern California (Irvine, Carson & LA); Silicon Valley (San Jose and Palo Alto); Vancouver, British Columbia; and Surrey, England; as well as a manufacturing facility in Normal, Illinois.

Internship Term: Summer 2021
Rivian internships are experiences optimized for student candidates. To be eligible, you must be an undergraduate or graduate student in an accredited program during the internship term. If you are not pursuing a degree, please see our full time positions at Rivian.com/careers

Role Summary

In this position you will support a Regional Manager with the execution of new charging sites in target service areas for DCFC and L2 charging.

Responsibilities
Be the boots on the ground gathering market intelligence, identifying strategic sites and surveying key local partners.
Collaborate with data science team to build suggested travel stops including, but not limited to: SoC (State of Charge) needed when departing, necessary stops en route and charging time at each stop
Support Regional Manager with any documentation related to the transaction process flow and critical dates, such as notices to exercise lease options.
Monitor and maintain internal project tracking system to ensure timely transaction completion .
Preparing presentations to relevant cross functional teams including Legal, Environmental Health & Safety and Executive Leadership.
Autonomy to run full cycle real estate charging process from initial outreach to charger deployment and activation, with support from Regional Manager.
Exposure to all critical charging teams: Site Development (Real Estate), Deployment (Construction), Data Science and Vendor Partners.


Qualifications
Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Masters in Real Estate Management, Business, Sustainability or other relevant degrees
Requires strong PowerPoint or Keynote skills
Requires intermediate to advanced Excel skills
Requires a very organized and motivated personality
Requires curiosity, and a desire to learn real estate and the Electric Vehicle charging market.
Requires good communication, writing and presentation skills.


Equal Opportunity

All employment decisions at Rivian are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Ensure prompt and accurate completion of vendor/supplier contracts and supporting certificates of insurance. Save all to appropriate databases.
Track and file vendor/supplier contracts and certificates of insurance; utilize provided databases to keep track of expirations and gain new contracts at least 60 days prior to expiration of former contract.
Utilize, monitor, maintain the work order system and prepare monthly reports for Property Manager regarding performance and status of work orders.
Maintain property, lease and contract files (hard copy and electronic) and any other files located within the real estate office.
Promote and foster positive relationships with tenants and owners and track service calls via work order system.
Other duties as assigned.

NEC offers in-house expertise that spans the full range of real estate disciplines-from the sourcing and analysis of target properties to zoning, capital-raising, architecture and design, construction management, marketing and property management. The intern will work closely with the Director of Marketing and Operations who will provide guidance throughout the duration of their internship. The intern will be paid on a daily rate. Notable skills we are looking for: Integrity and a commitment to excellence Strong analytical and computer skills, proficiency in Excel and Google Drive Excellent written and verbal communication skills and customer service skills Detail oriented Strong organizational skills Interns are paid at an hourly rate.
